result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M McBride

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Patrick M McBride in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Patrick M McBride.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is requesting another pre trial to see if they can come to an agreement. Bond is continued and this matter will be reset.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.

9:01 AM Defendant Patrick M McBride in court.  Prosecuting attorney Rose Marie Yanke in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendants attorney does not appear. Defendant will go to JA and try to contact Attorney Campbell Hunter. This matter will be reset.
Court appoints Attorney Shunette Campbell-Hunter as counsel - Defendant must pay $100.00 per month toward attorney fees commencing September 1, 2022.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact with SMK or residence
No contact with S.M.K. or residence.

1:31 PM Defendant Patrick M McBride appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Patrick M McBride. . 
Not guilty plea.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
